content:
ApplicationManifest Class

Definition

Describes a ClickOnce or native Win32 application manifest.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(false)]
[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlRoot("ApplicationManifest")]
public sealed class ApplicationManifest : Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.AssemblyManifest

Object

AssemblyManifest
ApplicationManifest

public ApplicationManifest ();

ComVisibleAttribute XmlRootAttribute

Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationManifest class.

public ApplicationManifest (string targetFrameworkVersion);
Parameters
targetFrameworkVersion
String

A token that represents a version of the .NET Framework.

Attributes
ComVisibleAttribute XmlRootAttribute

Properties

ConfigFile

Gets or sets the application configuration file.

public string ConfigFile { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that represents the name of the application configuration file.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

EntryPoint

Gets or sets an assembly reference that represents the entry point of the application.

public override Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.AssemblyReference EntryPoint { get; set; }
Value
AssemblyReference

An AssemblyReference object that represents the entry point of the application.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

ErrorReportUrl

Gets or sets the URL of the error report.

public string ErrorReportUrl { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that contains the URL of the error report.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

FileAssociations

Gets or sets the file associations that are defined in the manifest.

public Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.FileAssociationCollection FileAssociations { get; }
Value
FileAssociationCollection

A string that contains the file associations.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

HostInBrowser

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the application is hosted in a browser (as WPF Web Browser Applications are).

public bool HostInBrowser { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

A Boolean value that indicates whether the application being deployed will be hosted in a browser (True), or not (False). True applies only to WPF Web Browser Applications.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

For project types other than WPF Web Browser Applications, you should set HostInBrowser to False (the default value).

When you deploy a WPF Web Browser Application, you must set the HostInBrowser property to True. This causes the <hostInBrowser> tag to be added to the generated application manifest. This tag enables ClickOnce to deploy projects for browser-hosted applications, which contain .xbap files.

You will also have to make the application available only online by setting Install to False. If you do not do this, you will receive MSBuild Error MSB3116.

IconFile

Gets or sets the program icon file.

public string IconFile { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that represents the name of the icon file.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

The program icon is expressed in the generated application manifest and is used for the Start menu and Add or Remove Programs. If this the icon file is not specified, a default icon is used. For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

IsClickOnceManifest

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the manifest is a ClickOnce application manifest or a native Win32 application manifest.

public bool IsClickOnceManifest { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

A Boolean value that indicates whether the manifest is a ClickOnce application manifest (True) or a native Win32 manifest (False).

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

MaxTargetPath

Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum allowed length of a file path in a ClickOnce application deployment. If this value is specified, the length of each file path in the application is checked against this limit. Any items that exceed the limit cause a warning message. If this input is not specified or is zero, no checking is performed. For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

public int MaxTargetPath { get; set; }
Value
Int32

An integer that indicates the maximum allowed length of a file path in a ClickOnce application deployment.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

OSDescription

Gets or sets a value that specifies a textual description for the operating system dependency.

public string OSDescription { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that indicates the operating system dependency.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

OSSupportUrl

Gets or sets a value that specifies a support URL for the operating system dependency.

public string OSSupportUrl { get; set; }
Value
String

A string indicating the support URL for the operating system dependency.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

OSVersion

Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum required operating system version required by the application.

public string OSVersion { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that indicates the minimum required operating system version required by the application.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

Specifies the minimum operating system version required by the application. An example value is "5.1.2600.0" for Windows XP. If this input is not specified, a default value is used. The default value is the minimum supported operating system of the .NET Framework, which is "4.10.0.0" for Windows 98SE. However, if the application contains any native or Reg-Free COM references, the default is Windows XP. For a native Win32 manifest, this input is ignored.

Product

Gets or sets a value that specifies the ProductName property in the project file.

public string Product { get; set; }
Value
String

A string value that corresponds to the ProductName property in the project file.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

This property corresponds to the ProductName property in the project file. The default is null. If ProductName is null and UseApplicationTrust is True, the RegisteredOrganization value in the registry is written to the application manifest. If RegisteredOrganization is also null, the assembly name is used.

Publisher

Gets or sets a value that specifies the PublisherName property in the project file.

public string Publisher { get; set; }
Value
String

A string value that corresponds to the PublisherName property in the project file.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

This property corresponds to the PublisherName property in the project file. The default is null. If PublisherName is null and UseApplicationTrust is True, the assembly name is written to the application manifest.

SuiteName

Gets or sets the suite name that is defined in the manifest.

public string SuiteName { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that contains the suite name.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

SupportUrl

Gets or sets a value that specifies the SupportUrl property in the project file.

public string SupportUrl { get; set; }
Value
String

A string value that corresponds to the SupportUrl property in the project file.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

This property corresponds to the SupportUrl property in the project file. The default is null. If SupportUrl is null and UseApplicationTrust is True, an empty string is written to the application manifest.

TargetFrameworkVersion

Gets or sets a token that represents a version of the .NET Framework.

public string TargetFrameworkVersion { get; set; }
Value
String

A String that represents a version of the .NET Framework.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

TrustInfo

Gets or sets a value that specifies a trust object that defines the application security.

public Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.TrustInfo TrustInfo { get; set; }
Value
TrustInfo

A TrustInfo object that defines the application security.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

UseApplicationTrust

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher*, and crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl* properties are written to the application manifest.

public bool UseApplicationTrust { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

A Boolean value that indicates whether the crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Publisher*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.Product*, and crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.SupportUrl* properties are written to the application manifest. If the value is True, they are written to the application manifest. If the value is False, these properties are ignored.

Attributes
XmlIgnoreAttribute

Remarks

By default, the Product, Publisher, and SupportUrl properties are set to null. They are used only if UseApplicationTrust is True. If this property is True, the values of these properties are written to the corresponding tags in the application manifest.

If UseApplicationTrust is False (the default value), these properties are ignored.

This property corresponds to the UseApplicationTrust property in the project file.

XmlConfigFile

Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.ConfigFile* property to an XML file.

public string XmlConfigFile { get; set; }
Value
String

The value of the crosoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.ConfigFile* property.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute EditorBrowsableAttribute XmlAttributeAttribute

XmlEntryPointIdentity

Gets or sets a property that is used to serialize the entry point identity to an XML file.

public Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.AssemblyIdentity XmlEntryPointIdentity { get; set; }
Value
AssemblyIdentity

The entry point identity.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute EditorBrowsableAttribute XmlElementAttribute

public string XmlEntryPointParameters { get; set; }
Value
String

The entry point parameters.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute EditorBrowsableAttribute XmlAttributeAttribute

Value
String

The entry point for executing the assembly.

Attributes
BrowsableAttribute EditorBrowsableAttribute XmlAttributeAttribute

Methods

Validate()

Performs various checks to verify the validity of the manifest. Any resulting errors or warnings are reported in the OutputMessageCollection object.

public override void Validate ();
Attributes
ComVisibleAttribute XmlRootAttribute

Remarks

Before calling this method, you must set the TargetFrameworkVersion property so that the validation can verify application manifest against the correct version of the .NET Framework runtime.
